name: CoreGrafx
ports: HuCard slot, AV out, gamepad port
description: Not a new console, this was simply a re-release of the PC Engine, this time in a black case and with composite AV output.

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>Quite impressive, non ?!<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://www.page.sannet.ne.jp/sasajima/pc/cata/"><img src="http://www.page.sannet.ne.jp/sasajima/pc/cata/ban_pc1s.gif" border="0"></a> for the picture</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> ADVERT #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>Pravetz Apple II compatible technology and price  are compared with the IBM compatible Pravetz 8C.<p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Bojidar Stefanov</b> for the English translation</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> DICK SMITH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>Price list close-up in Australian$:<br> Basic CAT computer X-7500 <b>$1195.00</b><br> Disk Drive X-7505 <b>$1495.00</b><br> Disk Controller X-7510 <b>$149.95</b><br> Emulator Cartridge X-7530 <b>$149.95</b><br> Dual Joysticks X-7520 <b>$49.95</b><br> RF Modulator X-7550 <b>$49.95</b><br> RS-232C Serial Adaptor X-7515 <b>$149.95</b><br> Printer Cable (Centronics) X-7540 <b>$844.95</b><br> Filer Utilities Disk with DOS & Manual X-7512 <b>$59.95</b><br> High resolution RVB monitor X-1193 <b>$995.00</b><br> RGB Cable X-7560 <b>$44.95</b><br> High Res. Green Monitor X-1220 <b>$395.00</b></blockquote>

item.description: Pachinko Controller||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> PACHINKO CONTROLLER</strong></font><br><blockquote>This is a pachinko controller for the PC Engine.  The angled part which sticks out between the two main sections of the controller is a slider to adjust the angle of the pachinko balls as they come out. </blockquote>

emulator.name: Magic Engine
emulator.description: Commercial but excellent NEC PC Engine emulator. A must.

peripherals: PC Engine CD-ROM?, Super System Card, Arcade Card Pro, 6 button gamepad
